intro: Arenaria tetraquetra var. legitima, commonly known as the rock sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to alpine and rocky environments. It features compact, mat-forming growth with small, rounded leaves that are typically blue-green in color. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers during the spring and early summer. It is well adapted to harsh conditions, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its botanical characteristics make it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine plant collections.
